content.description: Directly right of The Fin. From holds on the block in back of the roof, reach to a tweaky two-finger pocket and jump to a pinch. Move to the sloper, then the lip. Kind of a circus trick.
content.protection: A couple of pads (place wisely) and a spotter for the swing.

content.description:
This route typically gets graded as a sport route because it is mainly a test of endurance. 

  Start at 'The Fin' and rather than topping out, continue traversing left for the entire span of the roof until you can head inwards towards just right of the start of 'The Bat Cave' and then finish/top out 'The Bat Cave.' Pumpy, good rests, and very fun.
content.location: Start at The Fin finish on Bat Cave

content.description: Nice roof crack right of The Bat Cave problem. Nice jams. Is there a known name?
content.location: Right of Bat Cave, obvious roof crack.

content.description: Priest Draw 101: Start in the back of the roof at big holds and climb out the right-facing rail feature. At the large opposing jugs (where the line intersects a perpendicular crack), either continue straight out to the fin, or cut right past a small pocket and undercling.
content.location: Near the center of the Bat Roof.

content.description:
To the right of The fin is a nice circus trick of a problem. Start to the right of the Underachiever block in the back of the roof, move to an obvious right facing side-pull and figure out how to pull through an awkward pocket to the shared finish the Underachiever (right finish). Contrive as you see fit.

 The grade will likely feel soft, V7 is the grade I was given
content.location:
To the right of The Fin there are 3 obvious problems. From left to right they are: Underachiever left (Start at the block, move through tweaky pockets to the handle bar; Underachiever right (Start at the block, trend right through tweaky pockets to shared finish w/ Dynamic Duo); Â and Dynamic Duo (independent start, look for the obvious side-pull and pocket/jug.)

 I think I've got that right???

content.description: Crux is the roof of this climb.    Start on a horn with good low feet, climb pockets and toe-cams to jug way out left for an easy topout.   Ultra-Classic at the grade.
content.protection: Watch the landing for the deadpoint
content.location: About 10 min walking into the draw, climb is on west side (right) starts on obvious horn and continue straight out 10 ft roof

content.description: The direct finish to Bat Roof. From the horn at the skirt, climb straight out the roof to a massive move(the crux)to a little rail below the lip of the roof. Top out over the drop-away landing. Seems kinda scary due to the landing, but the holds are so big that an uncontrolled fall is not likely.
content.location: Same start as Bat Roof problem.

content.description: The Bat Roof (or Bat Cave) is a highly featured roof with about half a dozen problems in the V1-V3 range and a few more difficult lines to the right. Dreamy jugs and pinches abound and make this an ideal spot to warm up and/or get acquainted with the Draw's style of climbing, as well as a popular hangout for moderate boulderers.
